awd_titl_txt: Analysis of Critical Flaws on the Surfaces of Window Glass  Using a Scanning Electron Microscope
awd_abstract_narration: Fractured mirrors from destructive tests performed from 1980 to 1985            were saved; this collection is unique in that it originated from                naturally occurring flaws on window glass plate and mirror surfaces.            Selected specimens will be analyzed using a scanning electron                   microscope to determine, among other observations:  the general shapes          of naturally occuring critical flows; differences between shapes and            sizes of flaws occurring on the surfaces of new and weathered window            glass plates; the differences between the critical flows for both types         of specimens when tested in full scale under uniform loading, and when          using the concentric rings tests; and the correlation between stress at         failure and flaw size at various flow direction/stress direction                relationships.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
